page.title: 07 GRAMMAR SCHOOL FOR GIRLS
page.content: THIS IS A STATE SCHOOL OF ABOUT 400 PUPILS AND 25 STAFF, UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF A HEADMISTRESS.IT WAS FORMED IN 1959 BECAUSE A PARTICULAR LOCAL COUNCILLOR HAD A TREMENDOUS INTEREST IN GIRLS' EDUCATION.NEARBY IS THE BOYS'GRAMMAR SCHOOL,WHICH IS 500 YEARS OLD. PLACES ARE AWARDED ON THE RESULTS OF AN 11-PLUS EXAMINATION CONSISTING OF VERBAL REASONING TESTS AND AN ESSAY, WHICH MAY BE TAKEN BY ANY PUPIL IN SOUTH WARWICKSHIRE. THE SCHOOL IS DIVIDED INTO 3 HOUSES NAMED AFTER FAMOUS AUTHORESSES, COMPETING FOR ACADEMIC AND SPORTING PRIZES.THE UNIFORM IS PURPLE, BLUE,AND YELLOW WHICH ALL PUPILS ARE EXPECTED TO WEAR. THE AVERAGE ATTAINMENT OF A PUPIL IS 8 O'LEVELS AND FOR THOSE CHOOSING A SIXTH FORM COURSE, 2 OR 3 A'LEVELS.
